title: Model Catalog
description: Schema for defining model and model servers for conversion to Backstage catalog entities

modelServer.description: A deployed model server running one or more models, exposed over an API

name.description: The name of the model server

url.description: The URL to access the model server

owner.description: The Backstage user that will be responsible for the model server

description.description: A description of the model server and what it's for

usage.description: How to use and interact with the model server

tags.description: Descriptive tags for the model server

apiURL.description: The URL that the model server's API is exposed over

apiType.description: The type of API that the model server exposes

apiSpec.description: The schema used by the model server API

apiTags.description: Descriptive tags for the model server's API

lifecycle.description: The lifecycle state of the model server API

authentication.description: Whether or not the model server requires authentication to access

models.description: An array of AI models to be imported into the Backstage catalog

items.description: An AI model to be imported into the Backstage catalog

owner.description: The Backstage user that will be responsible for the model

description.description: A description of the model and what it's for

usage.description: How to use and interact with the model

resourceURL.description: A URL to access the model's resources

apiURL.description: The URL that the model server's API is exposed over

support.description: Support information for the model / where to open issues

training.description: Information on how the model was trained

ethics.description: Any ethical considerations for the model

lifecycle.description: The lifecycle state of the model server API
